content.rendered: A Restraining Order is the judicial act of restricting or prohibiting a party from specific conduct or behavior. A restraining order is usually enforced using the civil and criminal contempt powers of the court. However, a violation of some types of restraining orders can result in criminal prosecution. Some restraining orders can have unintended consequences, such as affecting citizenship and the right to possess or purchase firearms.
